medical_history.chief_complaint: Primary amenorrhea, sexual infantilism, and hypertension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 is a 22-year-old female who presented with symptoms of primary amenorrhea and sexual infantilism, with hypertension noted at the time of examination. Blood pressure was measured at 170/105 mm Hg. Physical examination revealed completely absent sexual hair and infantile genitalia. In contrast, Patient 2, an 18-year-old female, also had primary amenorrhea, sexual infantilism, and hypertension, presenting with a blood pressure of 155/110 mm Hg. Both patients demonstrated abdominal findings of bilateral adrenal hyperplasia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients are affected by 17/H9251-hydroxylase/17,20-lyase deficiency syndrome confirmed by plasma and urinary steroid measurements. Patient 2 was diagnosed with androgen resistance syndrome at age 17 after the discovery of testes during surgical intervention for inguinal pain.
medical_history.family_history: Family history reveals consanguinity of the parents. The sister of Patient 1 was also affected by primary amenorrhea, sexual infantilism, and hypertension.
